• The present application is a continuation-in-part of a co-pending patent application for a Wave Anchor Soil Reinforcing Connector and Method.
• Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures are retaining wall structures that use horizontally positioned soil inclusions to reinforce an earth mass in combination with a facing element.
• A typical soil reinforcing element for MSE structures includes a welded wire grid with longitudinal and transverse wires.
• The wall end of each soil reinforcing element may include connective means to connect the element to a vertical facing, such as a wire, concrete, or steel facing.
• The disclosure provides a splice for a soil reinforcing element and a composite soil reinforcing element, including a soil reinforcing element, a grid-strip, and a splice that couples the reinforcing end of the soil reinforcing element to the splicing end of the grid-strip.
• The splice includes wave plates that define transverse protrusions to receive and seat transverse wires of the soil reinforcing element and the grid-strip, and a connective device that clamps down on the longitudinal wires of both elements.

</summary>

<summary>

• The invention describes a bedroom cabinet with an outer casing and an inner casing, providing strength and allowing for boxes for devices and shelves for personal belongings to be housed within the clearance between the two casings, without projecting from the cabinet.
• The clearance can also house wirings and increase sound-proofing. A venting groove can be added to spacer members in the clearance to allow for natural ventilation and further increase sound-proofing.
• The upper and lower outer housings of the cabinet are made of fiber reinforced plastic and have notch portions for forming an exit. The inner casing is made of six panels, including a front panel with an opening for the exit and boxes for devices, a back panel with boxes and a vented accommodating shelf, side panels with a TV shelf and backrest, a ceiling panel with vent holes, and a bottom panel with a rim for a mat.
• The panels are connected and fixed by seals or a fit-in type groove. The inner casing is first placed in the lower outer casing, and the upper outer casing is then fitted and held in place by flanges and a clip member. An ornamental web and edge frame are used to engage the notches of the upper and lower outer casings and the front panel.
• Articles such as a TV receiver are mounted within the assembled bedroom cabinet. A sheet can be used to cover the mat, and can be wound on a roller for easy cleaning. A second embodiment provides a clearance between the outer casings and inner casing, with spacer members of varying strength interposed to form an intake and exhaust passage and sound-proofing wall.

</summary>

<summary>

* The invention relates to a building system that allows for the creation of larger exterior panels without the need for movement control joints.
* The system involves the use of a reinforced plaster panel with a first mesh attached to battens, a second mesh supported by a plaster matrix, and the plaster matrix penetrating both meshes.
* The system can be used for panels of various sizes and shapes, including those with openings for doors and windows.
* The corners and edges of the openings are further reinforced to provide additional support and rigidity.
* The system can be used with various types of mesh and plaster matrix, including those that comply with New Zealand regulations.
* The system can be used for both new construction and retrofit applications.
* The system provides several benefits, including improved panel rigidity and integrity, compliance with regulations, and increased design flexibility.
* The system can be customized to meet the specific needs and requirements of various projects.

</summary>

<summary>

- The present invention is a pulsed power device and a method of using the pulsed power device for Enhanced Oil Recovery (EOR).
* Pulsed power is the rapid release of electrical energy that has been stored in capacitor banks, and can be used in a direct plasma mode or by discharging the energy through a coil to generate a short-lived but intense magnetic field.
* The energy release from the system can be used in a plasma, or electrohydraulic (EH) mode, to generate a shock wave that can be used in various processes including geophysical exploration, mining, and EOR.
* The Wesley '650 patent teaches a method for generating strong acoustic vibrations for reservoir stimulation using an electrohydraulic spark discharge, but it has a limited range of about 1000 feet.
* The present invention aims to address this issue by using pulsed power as the source to generate high-frequency acoustic stimulation of the reservoir separately from the direct acoustic response of the EH shock wave.
* This is achieved by using pulsed power to generate a strong electromagnetic pulse that travels at the speed of light across the reservoir, inducing a coupled acoustic vibration at very high frequencies in geologic materials like quartz.
* This induced acoustic vibration acts for a short period of time after the pulse is discharged, but is not limited by the natural acoustic attenuation that limits the effectiveness of a direct acoustic pulse source.
* The present invention also recognizes the importance of targeting specific scales of inclusions in the reservoir with the acoustic stimulation frequencies to optimize energy absorption and effective stimulation.
* The invention can be applied using a multi-level discharge device or multiple pulse sources in multiple wells to extend the effective range of the stimulation and achieve better stimulation of a specific volume of the reservoir.

</summary>

<summary>

- The document describes a patent application for a method of monitoring fluid pressure in geological formations. The method involves forming a borehole, placing a conduit into the borehole, and pumping cementitious material into the borehole to displace the cementitious material around the bottom inlet end of the conduit, forming a fluid connection to the formation. A pressure sensing device is then coupled to the formation fluid pressure within the conduit to measure the fluid pressure of the formation at the desired depth.
- Another embodiment of the method involves connecting a pressure sensing device to a bottom inlet end of a conduit, lowering the conduit into a borehole until the inlet end is at a depth where the formation pressure is to be measured, filling the borehole with cementitious material to a level above the inlet end of the conduit, and purging the inlet end of the conduit of cementitious material by pumping a liquid down the conduit. A lateral fluid path is then formed between the inlet end of the conduit and the formation, allowing the formation pressure to force formation fluid to flow through the fluid path and into the conduit, measuring the formation fluid pressure.

</summary>

<summary>

• The invention describes a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints with an expansion function, useful in new transit systems, monorails, road bridges, and footbridges.
• It includes multiple steps with expansion gaps, elastic members inside, and a joint block on top, designed to prevent tire fall-in and stuck-in situations, ensuring smooth vehicle traveling.
• The joint block's position is maintained at the center of the expansion gap through elastic member deformation, accommodating vertical, lateral, or kinked joint displacements due to earthquakes or temperature changes.
• The elastic members are made from a material that is hard to deform vertically and easy to deform horizontally, and are joined together using a joint block or backing plate, allowing for easy maintenance.
• The invention also discusses a method of mounting an elastic member, taking into account seasonal and temperature changes, ensuring the elastic member is free of deformation when the bridge girder reaches its median length.

</summary>

<summary>

- The invention describes a lock device for preventing a work machine, such as a boom of a backhoe, from being tilted by its own weight.
- The lock device includes an engaging member with a hook part and a slot, supported by a guide member and a support pin. An engaged member on the boom or boom bracket engages with the hook part to lock the boom in place.
- The guide member is always angled, ensuring the engaging member stays in place as the boom rotates, eliminating the need for a separate holding mechanism.
- The lock device is easy to operate, reduces the number of parts, and is adaptable to various work machines, such as excavators, loaders, and cranes.
</summary>

<summary>

• The invention is a swimming pool vacuum cleaner with an adjustable suction head that can easily regulate the suction being exerted during the pool cleaning operation.
• The adjustment mechanisms are conveniently located on the top of the vacuum head and can be quickly operated by hand without the need for hand tools.
• The suction exerted by the vacuum head can be precisely regulated without the need for regulation of the remotely located suction source.
• Adjustment mechanisms can be interconnected with certain types of existing, prior art pool cleaning devices without the need for major retrofit of the existing devices.
• The adjustment mechanism is simple and easy to use, easy to connect to existing devices and one which can be manufactured very inexpensively.

</summary>

<summary>

- The invention describes a precast concrete retaining wall system with a face panel and a base, both with integral counterforts for added support and stability.
- The face panel and base are connected using reinforcing bars and grout, eliminating the need for temporary shoring during installation.
- The system allows for flexibility in design, with the height or width of individual components varying over a wide range, and can be customized to specific site requirements.
- Additional features such as drainage openings, shear keys, and vehicle impact barriers can be incorporated into the design to enhance performance and safety.
- The system allows for taller walls and shorter bases, reducing installation and transportation costs compared to traditional cast-in-place retaining wall systems.

</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a floor track system for use in a fluid treatment chamber, such as a meat product chilling chamber.
• The track system prevents the brine solution from becoming contaminated by the wheels of hand trucks used to transport meat products in and out of the chamber.
• The chamber includes a brine distribution piping system, return piping system, brine receptor, and brine recirculation pump.
• The present invention relates to an enclosed floor track system for transporting hand trucks into and out of the fluid treatment chamber.
• The enclosed tracks are supported above the chamber floor by support legs and are slightly pitched to drain any liquid within the tracks into a waste sewer.
• The enclosed floor track system shown in FIG. 2 prevents showered or dripping brine from entering into the track system.
• The tracks include an open wheel channel into which the wheels of the hand truck are moved in the chamber and a wheel guide which keeps the hand truck centered within the bottom of the track system.
• The wheel channel includes a bottom portion and upwardly extending sidewalls, with the outer sidewall extending upwardly a distance greater than that of the inner sidewall.
• A cover plate generally overlies the top of the wheel channel and is attached to the outer sidewall by a hinge, which permits the cover plate to be pivoted away from the wheel channel to facilitate cleaning.
• The vertical space between the upper edge of the inner sidewall and the overlying cover plate accommodates the horizontal axle structure of the hand truck.
</summary>

<summary>

- The invention describes a new and improved safe and door structure, which is a readily assembled, low cost door and safe structure. The safe has a valuables receiving chamber with a generally rectangular opening and a separate steel door that can be placed on inwardly extending ledges on opposing walls. The door is retained in the chamber by a set of grooves formed on the opposite walls that provide stops for retaining the door. A lock assembly on the reverse side of the door has the latch bolt engaging a detent in one bar for prevention of lateral movement with reinforcing bolts on both sides of the lock bolt preventing transmission of force to the lock mechanism in the event of forceful intrusion attempts.
* The safe construction can be formed utilizing the construction described in applicant's U.S. Pat. No. 4,176,440, which is an in-place construction wherein a liner, preferably formed of an appropriate plastic material, is employed as a combination liner and form for the pouring of concrete thereabout to provide the majority of the body of the floor safe. The invention is equally applicable to a safe which is formed of all metal, such as by steel fabrication or steel casting methods.
* The safe includes bar members that are generally identically configured and are of a generally rectangular elongate configuration, having a length greater than the corresponding dimension of the grooves that receive them. The bar members are coupled together in spaced relation upon assembly, after insertion into the grooves. The bolt members engage the cutouts of the bar members, depending from the upper bar members, to retain the bar members in spaced generally parallel relation after assembly.
* The door is formed of a generally rectangular steel plate member having a lower edge that is rounded for reasons discussed in the patent. The lockset includes a combination dial accessible from the exterior of the door, a slidable lockbolt, and safety bolts secured to the undersurface of the plate member to reinforce the door assembly against lateral movement in the event an intruder attempts to pry the door laterally.

</summary>

<summary>

- The invention relates to downhole vibratory tools that allow other tools to pass through.
* Vibratory tools are used to dislodge stuck objects and transmit forces in deviated wellbores.
* Earlier designs did not have a clear central passageway for wireline access and had the dump valve in the center.
* A more recent design uses a drop-in dart with working components, but it has compromises in power delivery, fatigue, and cost.
* The new design features an annular dump valve for wireline access, a removable plug to initiate vibrations, and stacked pistons for increased power.
* The tool can deliver high amplitude, low-frequency oscillating forces without impacts on the housing.
* The mandrel is powered by stacked pistons in the tool body, and the components are made stronger for improved reliability.
* The tool can be run in various modes, including high amplitude oscillations and jarring blows, depending on the operation.
* The modular design allows for customization based on the power required and downhole conditions.
* The tool can also be used in stimulation or fishing operations and may include a rotational lock for torque transmission.

</summary>

<summary>

• The invention relates to a ladder attachment that improves stability, prevents damage to work surfaces, and allows ladders to straddle corners.
• The attachment includes a brace with a flange and a U-bolt that secures to a ladder rung, and a resilient pad that contacts the work surface.
• The brace is connected to a clamp that attaches to the ladder side rail, exerting a force to prevent movement of the brace and improve stability.
• The pad is pivotally connected to the brace, allowing it to move and conform to the work surface, increasing contact area and reducing damage.
• The attachment can be used with various ladder types, including aluminum and fiberglass, and can be adjusted for different ladder sizes.
• The design allows for the ladder to straddle corners, providing stability and access to difficult-to-reach areas.

</summary>

<summary>

- The invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving wear bushings in oil well drilling tools and apparatuses, which can be mounted on a drill string.
- Wear sleeves or bushings protect against excessive wear in seal areas of casing heads and other well head elements, including the joint of the housing and the initial length of pipe or casing.
- The apparatus includes a sub-unit with a mandrel, an upper collar section for engagement onto a section of pipe, and a threadably removable lower collar section for engaging the end of a second lower section of drill pipe.
- A retriever section is inserted onto the mandrel and has means for engaging with an extended J-slot of a wear bushing, allowing vertical movement of the retriever unit but preventing rotational movement.
- The apparatus allows for quick removal and installation of the wear bushing during the drilling operation.
- An additional embodiment of the retriever unit has a threaded lower end section for retrieving a particular type of wear bushing with a threaded collar section.
- The apparatus prevents damage to the retriever unit or the wear bushing due to excessive weight below the retriever.
- The retriever apparatus can be threadably engaged between any two sections of drill pipe without retrieval of the drill bit from the hole.
- The invention solves problems in the present state of the art in a simple and inexpensive manner.
- The apparatus allows for the removal of the wear bushing without the use of the bit, which is necessary when the drill pipe is lodged and the bit cannot be removed.

</summary>

<summary>

- The invention is a down-hole heating system for oil and gas wells to improve flow rates impeded by high oil viscosity and/or paraffin blockage.
- The system includes production tubing, a heat insulating packer, perforated tubing, a stainless steel tubing collar, and a heating unit with electrical resistance heater rods.
- The heat insulating packer and stainless steel collars contain the heat within the desired zone, focusing it on the production formation itself to heat oil and paraffin in situ.
- The electrical connections between the power leads and heater rods are impenetrably shielded from pressures and hostile chemical agents in the well bore using a cement block and steel fitting assembly.
- Solid copper leads with KAPTON insulation are used to reliably deliver power to the connection.
- The method for using the system includes installing the down-hole heating unit with shielded electrical connections and heat-retaining elements to focus heat on the producing formation.

</summary>

<summary>

- The invention describes a collated nail strip formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool.
* The nails are held parallel to one another in a staggered or stepped manner, with the major axis of the nail forming an angle with the longitudinal direction of the strip.
* Presently known collated nails are assembled using tape strips or an extruded plastic material, but these methods can create debris or housekeeping problems.
* The invention aims to reduce debris and improve adhesion of the plastic to the nail shanks, while also minimizing corrugation and maximizing the structural integrity of the strip.
* The collation system can be configured to permit the collation to be coiled for use in driving tools that accept collations in this manner.
* The invention also describes various configurations and features of the nail strip, such as tapered collars, angled ribs, embossed patterns, and notches, to further improve the performance and functionality of the strip.

</summary>

<summary>

• The invention describes a downhole tool for installing and retrieving objects in wells, including those that are stuck or lost. It is an improvement on previous patents and aims to provide an effective connection between a pull tool and a downhole object or fish, with a simple and effective disconnection mechanism.

• The tool is typically used in drilling and well servicing operations where objects may become lost or stuck in the wellbore. It can be used with wireline operations and is adapted for use in overshot or spear-based service operations. The tool has an outer tubular body with an inner body structure that moves telescopically to establish a gripping relation with the object to be removed. A catch mechanism locks and unlocks the inner and outer body structures.

• The tool is useful in situations where a light-weight wireline pulling tool is unable to accomplish the required pulling operations and becomes firmly fixed to the fish or other object. The invention aims to provide a downhole service equipment that can be easily disconnected from the fish or other object in such situations, reducing the need for costly retrieval operations.

• The tool's design allows for controlled, locking, and unlocking of the collet or spear slip structures with respect to the object to be removed. This is achieved through a controllable locking mechanism that incorporates guide pins and latching recesses, ensuring that the operating personnel can efficiently control the tool's movement.
</summary>

<summary>

* The text describes an aquarium lighting system using LEDs with adjustable color temperature and intensity.
* The system includes a housing with a lighting control region having separate channels for controlling different colors of light, and switches for controlling the channels.
* Light-emitting modules are removably coupled to the lighting control region and include LEDs that emit light of a specific color, and electrical connectors that engage the channels to provide power to the LEDs.
* The modules can be arranged in different orientations and configurations to achieve desired lighting effects.
* The system can also include remote control, timers, and optics members for altering the angle and diffusion of emitted light.
* The lighting system can also be used for under-cabinet lighting in kitchens or offices.

</summary>

<summary>
• The invention describes a position sensor that modifies an unconditioned sensing signal from a transducer into a conditioned sensing signal using a waveform generator and an error correction generator.
• The error correction generator determines and eliminates strong static signals and error signals that do not deliver information about the position of an object being sensed.
• A window reference circuit constantly compares a desired conditioned sensor signal output to an existing conditioned sensor signal output and adjusts the conditioned sensor signal output if it is above a preset high reference signal or below a preset low reference signal.
• The sensor monitoring system is remotely located and provides power to the sensor and receives the conditioned sensing signal via two wires, making the sensor desirable for multiplexing with other sensors.
• The sensor can be recalibrated at any time by removing and reapplying power.
• The sensor determines and eliminates strong static signals or other error signals that do not deliver information about the position of the object being sensed, whose inclusion in the sensor output signal would waste energy.
</summary>

<summary>

* The invention describes a system and method for controlling a fuel delivery system in a vehicle, which can be switched between manual and automatic control. The system aims to provide smooth transitions between control modes without causing the vehicle to lurch forward or stall.
* The system comprises a control unit that receives accelerator pedal position and throttle valve position signals. Based on these signals, the control unit automatically sets the throttle position for optimum vehicle performance. The control unit also provides an output signal that controls a clutch, connecting the accelerator pedal directly to the throttle valve when manual control is desired.
* The system allows for manual control of the throttle valve when a malfunction is detected in the automatic control unit or when manual control is required for specific driving conditions, such as high transmission ratios in a continuously variable transmission.

</summary>

<summary>
• The document describes a desmodromic valve actuation system for intake and exhaust function of a four-stroke piston in internal combustion engines, aimed at improving valve control and reducing gas consumption.
• The system eliminates the use of springs, which are prone to wear and require significant energy to compress and decompress.
• The system uses a rotating cam and a translating mechanism to control the valve position, which can be varied infinitely to control the percentage of port opening.
• The system can also control the timing and duration of valve opening and closing, which is critical for efficient engine performance.
• The system can be computer-controlled to optimize engine performance and fuel efficiency based on driving conditions.
• The system offers several advantages over traditional cam/spring valve actuation systems, including higher engine speed performance, simpler construction, and reduced wear and tear.
• The system can also improve fuel economy by controlling the amount of air/gas mixture entering each piston and closing any number of cylinders during operation.
• The system is applicable to various types of internal combustion engines, including those with multiple valves per cylinder.
</summary>

<summary>

* The invention is a nozzle for applying sealants such as silicones, useful in various industries including aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics.
* The nozzle has a bell or hood lower section and an injection button, and is designed for use with both manual cartridges and automatic injection machines.
* The bell-shaped tip facilitates the encapsulation of rivets or nuts, and the injection button has a special design with channels and orifices for precise sealant application.
* The button section improves the encapsulation and provides an optimum sealing of rivets and nuts, and allows the user to apply sealant operations both manually and by automated sealant injection machines.
* The nozzle may be used in the aviation industry and the automotive, naval, railway and robotics industries.
* The nozzle comprises a main elongated hollow body with a truncated cone shape, a threaded exterior surface for connecting to a sealant cartridge or injection machine, and a bell or hood shaped section for encapsulating rivets or nuts.
* The injection button is connected to the bell-shaped section and has a circular main body with radially oriented channels ending in orifices.
* The annular flanged section of the bell shaped section cooperatively matches with the peripheral groove of the injection button, allowing a strong and firm non-permanent connection.
* The nozzle may be used to apply sealants in a precise manner, preventing the plugging of screw orifices and enabling fast, clean, and uniform riveting.
* The nozzle simplifies the sealing work, reduces sealant application time, saves time and labor, provides a more economical sealing process, and increases the quality of the resulting sealant application.

</summary>

<summary>

• The present application is related to modular composed stave floors and claims priority to several earlier patent applications.
• Thin sight substrates in known stave floors can deform or become detached when sanded or rushed, leading to a loss of physical, aesthetic, and functional properties.
• The sight substrate is typically "de-rolled" wood, which can curl or recover its original form, while the base substrate is composed of slung wood or is plated against. Both sheets are joined by glue, which can result in deformations, changes of displacement, and changes of dimensions if a uniform and level surface of assembly and constant pressure are not maintained during a long cure time.
• The life of composed stave floors is short due to the thin thickness of the sight substrate, and corrective maintenance is not possible. Joining the sheets without displacement or change of dimensions is a challenge.
• The example embodiment provides a method for the manufacture of composed stave floors that includes providing a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm. The base substrate and sight substrate are assembled together with glue and multidirectional holding means.
• The multidirectional holding means consist of dendrites, adhesion and horizontal reinforcement means in the union plane, and adhesion and vertical reinforcement means normal to the union plane.
• The example embodiment aims to preserve the physical, aesthetic, and functional properties of the sight substrate, provide a sight substrate without a tendency to be deformed, bond both sheets without displacement or change of dimensions, increase the useful life of the floors, allow corrective maintenance, and provide improved composed stave floors with applied glaze from the supplier.
• The numerical parameters and ranges described in the specification and claims are approximations that can change depending on the properties provided by the example embodiments.
• FIG. 2 shows a perspective cross-section view of a composed stave floor or engineering floor according to the example embodiment, and FIG. 3 illustrates multidirectional holding means.
• The example embodiments can be varied in many ways while still falling within the scope of the claims.
</summary>

<summary>

* The invention describes a cooled flow deflection apparatus for high temperature fluid-flow machines, such as cooled stator or rotor blades for gas turbines.
* Present-day flow deflection apparatuses are subjected to high ambient temperatures and require internal cooling channels to reduce metal temperature.
* Cast separating walls and deflection devices (ribs) have disadvantages, such as difficulty in cooling the transitional region, thermal stresses, high blade weight, and complex casting process.
* The invention proposes using separate inserts for separating walls, which are subsequently inserted into the apparatus and secured, instead of casting them together.
* This approach has advantages such as reduced material in the transitional region, no thermal stresses, reduced blade weight, simpler cast core, and easier adjustment of the cooling system.
* A first preferred embodiment is a hollow casting with holders for inserts, and the separating walls are preferably flat metallic or heat-resistant non-metallic strips.
* The inserted separating walls can be connected by an integral material joint, such as soldering or welding, for a secure seating.
* The invention can be applied to blades in a gas turbine, especially rotor blades that rotate at high speed, with cooling channels and separating walls extending in the radial direction.

</summary>

<summary>

- The invention describes an evaporative cooler system that uses a heat exchanger to separate the evaporating water from the cooling air stream, achieving sensible cooling. The system draws at least a major portion of the working air from the room to be cooled, which has a lower wet bulb temperature than outside air, resulting in a larger temperature differential and more efficient cooling. The system includes an array of spaced vertically directed hollow elongated tubular members, with the wet side accomplished by gravity flow of water downwardly along the inner surfaces of the tubes in conjunction with countercurrent flow of returned air from the load, and the dry side accomplished by fresh air flowing in thermal conductive contact with the outer surfaces of the tubular members for cooling.
* A hybrid system is also described, which incorporates the components of a vapor compression refrigeration unit. In this system, a minor portion of the useful air is passed over the evaporator of a vapor compression refrigeration system, cooling it sufficiently below its dew point to dehumidify that portion of the air, resulting in a greater reduction in the dry bulb temperature of the useful air. Other features are provided which, while decreasing somewhat from the total efficiency of the basic system, provide a greater degree or rate of cooling for specialized applications and/or for high cooling rate usage.

</summary>

<summary>

- The invention describes archery equipment improvements, including a point cap system with a point cap and balance pin that can be adjusted in weight for perfect arrow balance. The design also prevents dirt from entering the arrow shaft when points are not attached.
- The point cap is an externally threaded end that reduces stress on graphite shafts and can be permanently or removably attached to the arrow shaft. The balance pin can be adjusted in weight by trimming its heavy, soft metal shaft.
- The invention also includes an internally threaded point adaptor for attaching various types of arrow points with external threads, a nock cap adaptor for attaching nocks to the end of an arrow shaft, and means for uniformly encapsulating or capping the end of an arrow shaft with a material that has nearly the same strength properties in all directions like steel or aluminum.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention describes a method and apparatus for generating heat from particulate-laden gas or waste fuels such as wood waste.
• The invention aims to provide a waste fuel burner that emits minimal quantities of particulate materials, operates with little slag or clinkers, and can effectively burn wet wood of 70% moisture content.
• The apparatus forms a conical pile of waste fuel with preheated underfire air percolating up through the pile, drying and gasifying the waste fuel.
• The volatile gases driven off the pile are partially oxidized by additional combustion air in a first combustion chamber, with the total amount of combustion air maintained at less than stoichiometric proportions.
• A flame holder in the primary combustion chamber forces volatile gases and any entrained particulate matter out to the walls of the throat, causing such entrained matter to centrifugally separate and fall back into the primary chamber.
• The volatile gases move around the disc-shaped flame holder into a second combustion chamber where secondary combustion air is introduced for complete combustion.
• The secondary combustion air introduced in the secondary combustion chamber is directed tangentially to regulate the position of the flame within the chamber.
• Additional blend air can be added to the discharge of the secondary chamber to cool the air for industrial purposes other than boiler heat.
• The swirl air and secondary combustion air combine to maintain good separation of the particulate from the gas stream, keeping the particulate out of the secondary chamber.
• The primary and secondary chambers can be added to any source of dirty particulate-laden combustible gas to burn the gas and remove the particulate for meeting environmental emission standards.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to engine compression release brakes, specifically for engines having less brake systems than cylinders.
• Traditional systems include a brake for each cylinder, but the invention proposes reducing components by attaching brakes only to a portion of the cylinders.
• This modular system improves overall engine robustness by reducing excess components.
• The engine includes an engine housing with multiple cylinders, and a compression release brake for a portion of those cylinders.
• Each brake is operably coupled to a cam-actuated exhaust valve.
• The engine housing also has a low pressure reservoir, a high pressure pump, a high pressure manifold, and a hydraulic system.
• An electronic control module manages fuel injection timing and engine compression release brake timing.
• The brake system consists of a brake body, an electrical actuator (such as a solenoid), a valve member, a spool valve member, a lash adjuster, and a lash screw.
• The system allows for efficient engine braking while reducing the number of components, resulting in improved engine performance and durability.
</summary>

The provided summary includes the essential points from the source document, focusing on the main aspects of the invention, its advantages, and the components involved in the engine compression release brake system.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure such as an auxiliary gearbox.
• Aircraft gas turbine auxiliary gearboxes must withstand various loads, including blade-off events which cause severe shocks and major damage.
• The mounting link includes a male link, a female link, and a pin that selectively retains the male link and female link.
• The female link receives the male link to allow translation and forms a radial interface that dampens translation.
• The mounting link can be used in a gearbox assembly that includes a gearbox, driveshaft connection, peripheral load connections, seal, and mounting links.
• The seal and mounting links constrain the gearbox with respect to the engine in six degrees of freedom, without over constraining.
• The mounting link can rigidly constrain one degree of freedom between the engine and the gearbox, but extreme loads may break the rigid constraint.
• The interface between the female link and male link dampens the relative motion within the permitted range of motion.
• The increased and damped mobility of the gearbox allows the mounting link to absorb extreme shocks without transmitting potentially destructive loads.
• The pin is designed to shear at a known load magnitude corresponding to the maximum structural capability of the gearbox assembly and engine mounting structure.
</summary>

<summary>
• The document describes an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for small arms training, which is a cost-effective and realistic alternative to using blanks and a blank fire adapter.
• The simulator consists of a low-cost plastic expendable housing a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic in conjunction with an electrical ignition system, which is installed in a firing unit that can be inserted into the weapon via the magazine breech.
• The electrical control circuit provides for automatic and semi-automatic fire, and interfaces with the weapon trigger and bolt.
• The circuitry of the Small Arms Firing Effect Simulator (SAFES) consists of ten functional blocks, plus battery and expendable.
• The system uses a bolt interface, a trigger interface, an oscillator control, a 500 Hertz oscillator, a 10 Hertz oscillator, a firing counter, firing decoder, firing control, firing sensors, and a Multiple Integrated Laser Engagement System (MILES) interface.
• The SAFES simulator is designed to resemble the magazine clip of the M16 rifle and is packaged within a reusable housing, with the electric control circuitry and the plastic expendable containing pyrotechnic charges housed in the lower end.
</summary>

<summary>

• The invention describes a two-part bracket system for mounting speakers or other equipment to various surfaces or structures, such as poles, walls, or columns. The system comprises a stationary bracket attached to the mounting surface and an adjustable bracket connected to the object to be mounted. The adjustable bracket can be easily positioned and rotated into a locked position on the stationary bracket, allowing for simple installation by one person. The bracket system is designed for durability, ease of use, and versatility, with features such as tapered springs, integrated hooks and tabs, and adjustable axel screws.

• The invention also includes a pole clamp assembly for mounting the bracket system on poles or cylindrical surfaces. The pole clamp assembly consists of adapter brackets with stepped teeth for an ideal fit on various diameters and a chain with threaded J-hooks for easy tensioning and secure attachment. The stationary mounting bracket can be directly secured to the pole via the chain, hooks, and wing nuts, providing 360 degrees of horizontal adjustment.
</summary>

<summary>

• The invention describes an air intake device for an internal combustion engine with a tank, first and second passages, and a valve with actuating means. The first and second passages connect the tank to the air intake passage at different locations, with the second passage having a smaller cross-sectional area than the first. The valve is located in the first passage and is actuated based on engine operating conditions.
• The design aims to improve engine performance by utilizing dynamic effects while reducing air intake noise. The two passages and tank create a resonator that absorbs noise, and the narrow passage in the second pipe reduces noise to an acceptable level.
• The valve is controlled to create a new compound curve with peak portions of existing curves, improving engine performance. The valve is preferably closed when the engine load is below a certain line and opened only in specific engine speed and load regions.
• The operation of the valve is determined based on engine speed, throttle position, and engine load, which can be detected by various means, including the position of the throttle valve or the vacuum level in the intake manifold.

</summary>

<summary>

- The application claims priority to U.S. patent application 62/055,020, filed Sep. 25, 2014, and relates to pumps for pumping fluids, particularly for pumping liquid manure from a reservoir in high volumetric flow rate and high pressure.
- The fluid pump comprises two or more pump heads configured in series, each pump head having a housing within which an impeller is contained, driven by a drive structure to move fluid. The housing comprises an inlet through which fluid is drawn from outside the housing, and the fluid is moved by the impeller from the housing into at least two fluid conduits, preferably at least three fluid conduits, to be combined into one fluid flow before exiting the pump head.
- The drive structure may comprise one or more drive shafts on which the impellers are mounted, and may be powered by a single power source, such as an electric motor, a hydraulic motor, a combustion motor, or any other motor that can be configured to drive the drive structure.
- The pump heads are disposed in series so that fluid flows sequentially through each pump head of the pump, and are removably connected to facilitate repair and the inclusion of more pump heads in the series to increase the operating pressure of the pump.
- The fluid pump cannot be constructed by simply stacking known pumps together, as the initial and final pump heads have different design features to permit fluid flow from one pump head to the other, while commonly driving the impellers.
- The pump assembly comprises a fluid pump mounted on a support structure, such as a wheeled boom, a hitching assembly, or a trailer, which permits operation of the pump at a fluid reservoir.
- The novel features of the invention should not be limited by the embodiments, but should be given the broadest interpretation consistent with the wording of the claims and the specification as a whole.

</summary>

<summary>

- The invention describes a burner system for heat utilizing appliances, which includes a burner with a combustion chamber and a fuel holder, and a plurality of interchangeable or modular heat utilizing appliances.
- The burner is designed to optimize efficiency and limit unburned fuel emissions by using a solid fuel, such as firewood or charcoal briquettes, and facilitating primary, secondary, and tertiary combustion.
- The system includes various components, such as an air inlet opening, an ash pan, a hook and multiple position catch, legs for support, a cover, and a grill, all of which can be manually adjusted to control air flow, prevent inadvertent ingress of objects, and enable long-term operation.
- The modular heat utilizing appliances can be detachably coupled to the burner using a coupling, such as a draw latch, and can include various types of cookers, a gas-to-gas heat exchanger, and a pyrolyzer.
- The pyrolyzer is designed to pyrolyze carboniferous materials, such as vegetation, and includes a substantially air-tight heating chamber, a condenser, and various conduits and valves for conducting and controlling the flow of vaporized products of pyrolysis.

</summary>

<summary>
• The invention describes a method for minimizing flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing.
• The method uses control valve positions as feedback to maintain constant total mass flow through several parallel turbine inlet flow control valves, which in turn maintains constant steam generator pressure and minimizes turbine power changes.
• The flow difference between the N and N-1 condition is determined during the turbine design process and applied to the total flow demand to each of the N-1 valves on the basis of the total N valve demand derived from the position of the valve under test.
• The system includes a load sensor, speed sensor, and pressure sensor that provide inputs to a load controller, speed controller, and pressure controller. The outputs of these controllers, in combination, constitute the processor controller's flow demand.
• The test compensation circuit uses control valve positions as feedback and compensates by adjusting the flow through parallel control valves to minimize flow disturbance caused by the closure and reopening of turbine control valves during testing.
</summary>

<summary>

- The invention aims to improve combustion efficiency and cooling characteristics in rotary internal combustion engines, minimizing thermal distortion and structural failure risks.
- Spark plug bosses are arranged in a staggered manner with respect to the coolant flow centerplane, promoting high-speed coolant flow between bosses and reducing locally high thermal conditions.
- The rotary engine comprises a housing, rotor, induction system, ignition system, cooling passageway, and boss means for containing ignition means within the water passageway.
- The spark plugs are positioned on the trochoid surface, offset from the centerline of the trochoid wall, while the bosses are arranged to create a definite offset in the coolant passage.
- The staggered configuration controls high-velocity flow and maintains a high heat transfer coefficient at sensitive spark plug boss surfaces.
- Tests show a 44% increase in heat transfer coefficient between the flow and bosses with the staggered configuration compared to the in-line arrangement.
- The temperature gradient across the gas side of the wall is more uniform and flat with the staggered configuration, and the spark plug terminal offset is crucial for achieving the invention's benefits.
- The invention is particularly important for spacings between bosses up to 50 boss diameters when side wall effects can be ignored, and up to 12 diameters when side wall effects are present.

</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a mixing valve for an aircraft cleaning apparatus with two inlets and one outlet, allowing for a solution mixture ranging from 0% to 100% for each inlet.
• Previous cleaning apparatuses use various valve mechanisms to mix fluids, and it is desirable in the commercial airline industry to have a stand-alone cleaning apparatus with adjustable cleaning solution strength.
• The present invention meets these objectives with a valve body, inlet passages, and a valve means that is adjustable to permit the mixture to range between 0% and 100% for each inlet.
• The valve means is made up of a spool valve and various valve components, including a flow restricting device and a mechanism for restraining translational movement of the spool valve.
• The spool valve directs the flow of fluids to the outlet passage, and the fluid mixture strength is adjustable through a gripping portion on the adjustment handle.
• The operation of the valve system involves rotational movement of the valve, which results in differing proportional mixtures of the two fluids emerging from the outlet passage.
• The design of the valve system allows for continuous analog control of the proportional quantities of fluids and maintains constant fluid pressures at the inlets.
</summary>

<summary>

- Spacecraft structures using lightweight composites have low damping, leading to high vibration levels that can compromise functionality of instruments mounted on precision kinematic mounts (KM), which have little inherent damping. Conventional kinematic mounts have limited success in minimizing loads transmitted to the instrument.
* The present invention aims to provide kinematic mounts with novel damping features and a passive energy dissipating mechanism to protect the instrument from flight loads. It also aims to reduce manufacturing complexity and costs, and improve KM performance by uncoupling the mount suspension modes.
* The invention inserts vibration damping materials into kinematic mounts to dissipate high energy disturbances to the instrument, while preserving strength, stiffness, and kinematic features. Damping materials can be added at machined hinge or flexure locations of the mounts.
* Two embodiments of the damper design are presented, one using a spherical damper placed around a flexure area and the other using a cylindrical slot damper with o-rings placed within slots. These designs can significantly increase damping and improve KM performance.

- Electronic components produce heat when operating, and in some applications, free convection cooling is sufficient. However, in many applications, electric fans are used to move ambient air across electronic components to prevent overheating.

* Embodiments of the invention disclose a system for eliminating traditional fasteners used for securing cooling fans to an enclosure, which can be utilized in various applications including automotive, computer, electronic instrumentation, or any industry where forced movement of air is used as a temperature controlling medium.
* The cooling fan assembly includes a motor, fan blade, and motor output shaft, and can be used in any application where forced air movement is relied upon for adequate cooling.

* The height of turned-out portions of each mounting leg is less than or equal to the height of the recessed portion, allowing one or more adjacent components to directly abut the exterior of the enclosure.

- The invention describes an oil shear type clutch unit for large power transmission requirements, such as in aircraft catapult systems, that overcomes disadvantages of previously known constructions. It provides strong coupling forces between plates and discs while maintaining high control accuracy and minimizing residual drag.
- The clutch unit comprises an input shaft, an output shaft, a plurality of clutch plates connected to one shaft, a plurality of clutch discs interleaved between the plates and connected to the other shaft, and separate means for closing the gap between each clutch disc and its adjacent clutch plates. The means comprises piston and cylinder means connected to the clutch plates on opposite sides of each clutch disc, and fluid pressure control means for simultaneously supplying pressurized fluid in parallel to all piston and cylinder means.
- The clutch discs are made up of a plurality of arcuate segments in a circumferential arrangement, with each segment having longitudinally extending supporting means and co-acting portions on the supporting means and the edges of the clutch disc segments for holding the segments in position. The segments can be removed separately for replacement without disturbing the other segments.
- The system includes a servo control valve, a first and second stage fluid amplifier, and a reservoir supplying fluid to three pumps for the servo control valve, first stage amplifier, and second stage amplifier. The servo control valve provides extremely accurate fluid pressure control in response to various conditions, such as torque output profiling in a catapult system.

<summary>

- The invention describes a method and arrangement for compressing and cooling natural gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas. The method involves compressing the gas to a higher pressure, cooling it by heat exchange, and feeding it back into the pipeline at a lower temperature and increased pressure. The arrangement includes compressors, heat exchangers, valve-controlled pipelines, and control units. The invention utilizes the cooling effect of expanding compressed gas to a lower pressure to reach the desired exit temperature.
- The invention proposes a different type of cooling during the warmer period of the year, when re-cooling units were necessary in the past for ensuring the required exit temperature. The present invention utilizes the physical effect that a compressed gas is inevitably cooled when expanded to a lower pressure. The gas is compressed to an excess pressure, cooled by heat exchange, and then expanded to the desired exit pressure. The excess pressure is selected so that cooling during expansion is sufficient for obtaining a temperature reduction to the desired exit temperature.
- The expansion can be carried out in a simple manner, such as by means of a valve, or more significantly by an expansion turbine that recovers mechanical energy for providing a portion of the drive energy for the compression of the gas to the intended excess pressure. The compression to the excess pressure can be carried out in a total of three stages, with a predominant portion of the compression taking place in two successive primary compression stages. The gas is cooled between the two primary compression stages and then further cooled before expansion in an expansion turbine.
- The invention allows for the use of compressors in the stages to be completely exchanged for one another, providing flexibility in operation during different seasons. The compressors can be operated in parallel during peak load periods, and additional compressors can be used as needed during breakdowns or maintenance. The invention provides an overall better possibility of using the principal units of the compressor stations throughout the entire year.

</summary>

* This invention relates to a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, specifically for magnetic field compensation using two sensors and a digital processor.
* The system aims to compensate both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields, perform a simulation of measuring electromagnetic interfering fields at the protected object's location, and equalize potential feedback effects when using two magnetic field compensation systems in close proximity.
* The system consists of two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and a control unit (preferably a Digital Signal Processor or a field programmable gate array).
* The six output signals from the two real sensors can be combined into three output signals of a virtual sensor using a freely definable kind of averaging, achieved through a matrix multiplication in the control system.
* The control system receives the six output signals from the two real magnetic field sensors and uses a 6x6 matrix M to calculate the output signals of the virtual sensor.
* The virtual sensor's output signals are used as input for independent control loops operating in parallel, which can be broadband or selective concerning a frequency range or a single frequency.
* The control loops have control algorithms that transform the virtual input signals into changed signals, described by an operator Ω.
* The matrix {circumflex over (V)} is multiplied by a 6x6 matrix L to obtain control signals for the six coils.
* The compensation system can be adjusted for homogeneous or inhomogeneous interference, using a single actuator coil instead of a pair of Helmholtz coils if necessary.
* If two compensation systems are operated directly beside each other, a 6x6 feedback or crosscoupling matrix C is used to describe the feedback between the two systems and avoid interferences.

</summary>

• The invention involves the use of waveguide holograms (WGH) for controlled illumination of objects with specific requirements, such as display holograms or spatial light modulators (SLMs).
• Thin substrate waveguides, characterized by t>>λ, allow for convenient white light illumination and uniform illumination.
• These waveguides can be used for controlled illumination of demanding objects, such as holograms and SLMs, by optically coupling them to a coherent light source, like a laser.
• The system provides high diffraction efficiencies, and non-uniformity in the diffracted wavefront can be compensated for during exposure or recording.
• WGHs have advantages as illuminators, such as the absence of stray light and high diffraction efficiency, but also have penalties like alignment sensitivity and nonuniformity of the diffracted wavefront.
• The invention can be implemented using two basic architectures for recording the WGH grating, with the second configuration suitable for waveguides with more stringent requirements.

* Customized rules are created for different types of memory regions based on standard logic rules, with more liberal memory-based parameters pushed onto stricter logic-based parameters.
* A program can be executed on any number of conventional computing systems for creating such customized rules and performing design rule checks on mask pattern data based on customized rule sets.

* The invention describes a rolling body guide cage and a method for manufacturing it, which aims to reduce production costs.
* The guide cage is made from a ring element produced from a sheet metal material, with an axial profiling formed by forming techniques and several rolling body guide structures arranged in succession in the circumferential direction.
* The ring element is composed of at least two flat material ring segments which are joined to one another in succession in the circumferential direction and connected, in particular welded, to one another in a production step which precedes the formation of the axial profiling.
* The flat material ring segments are put together across an engagement zone and welded along edge regions which face one other therein, forming an undercut geometry which preliminarily couples the ring elements to one another in the circumferential direction.
* The joint contours are preferably configured such that adequate coupling of the ring segments is produced with as short as possible a weld seam length and the weld seams taper both towards the ring element inner circumferential edge and towards the ring element outer circumferential edge with as obtuse an angle as possible.
* The flat material ring segments are cut out, in particular punched out, from a sheet metal material, preferably as 120° ring segments, which allows for a relatively high material saving and easy punching out in close succession from a sheet metal strip.
* The concept according to the invention of the production of the rolling body guide cage from a welded ring segment is suitable for the manufacture of radial bearing cages and axial bearing cages, in particular cages of groove and angular ball bearings.
* The ring segments can be produced in such a manner that they initially have a slight oversize and are initially further cut and where necessary calibrated after welding in the context of a contouring step, or cut to their final dimensions in terms of their material width and are subsequently only formed and where necessary punched internally.
* The punching and welding steps can be carried out such that these overlap chronologically, and the welding is preferably carried out by a laser beam guided in a path-controlled manner.
* The invention can achieve a high-quality design of the weld connection points by generating a material bead close to the edge prior to the punching out of the ring segment or during punching out

• The invention relates to a fabrication method for coated steel plates used in welded and heat-treated parts, aiming to improve mechanical strength, impact resistance, and corrosion resistance.
• The method described in patent EP 0971044 is applied to butt-welded blanks, where hot- or cold-rolled steel plates coated with aluminum or aluminum alloy are butt-welded, followed by heat treatment and hot-pressing.
• The current invention aims to solve difficulties encountered in the previous method, where welding coated steel blanks results in intermetallic areas that reduce the overall deformability of the welded joints.

A portion of the metal alloy layer is removed from at least one precoated face of the plate, preferably by brushing or laser beam.

* The method involves using a manager effectuated by native instructions to authorize requests from managed applications to access native system resources through managed libraries, and using a runtime host effectuated by native instructions to access the native system resources.

The invention aims to identify rotor defects by measuring the resistance, reactance, and effective electrical skew of the rotor.
- The invention is designed to be cost-effective by only testing each rotor before it is assembled with a stator, rather than testing every individual rotor. The testing process provides information on the rotor's resistance, reactance, and skew, which can be used for quality control and defect evaluation.
- The apparatus includes a test head with exciting means to magnetize the rotor, voltage sensing means to generate a voltage signal responsive to the magnetic flux variations, current sensing means to sense the magnitude of the alternating current used to magnetize the rotor, and processing means to determine the resistance and reactance of the rotor.
- The apparatus may also include skew sensing means to sense the effective electrical skew of the rotor and determine an effective electrical skew of the rotor. The invention provides automatic pass/fail determinations and can identify defective rotors, making it a reliable and efficient testing method.

• The invention is a gauging fixture for automatically spin checking driven disc assemblies in friction clutches.
• The apparatus includes an enclosure with a stationary and movable ring, a torque motor with a splined hub, and a mechanism to move the movable ring.
• The driven disc assembly is mounted on the hub and positioned between the rings.
• The torque motor exerts a predetermined torque on the driven disc assembly, attempting to rotate it against the frictional force generated by the rings.
• The frictional force is gradually reduced, causing the driven disc assembly to rotate if it is not excessively warped.
• An electronic sensor measures the distance between the rings and the rotation of the driven disc assembly.
• The difference between these distances is compared with a standard value to determine if the driven disc assembly is excessively warped.
• The apparatus operates automatically, without manual involvement by an operator, and generates an external indication of whether the driven disc assembly is good or bad.
• The invention improves efficiency, accuracy, and operator safety in the production environment.

</summary>

<summary>

* The invention describes a method for implementing a FIFO queue in a functional memory using a tree-shaped data structure.
* In functional memories, updates are carried out in such a way that first the path from the root of a tree-shaped structure to the point of updating is copied, and the update is made in the copied data.
* The tree-shaped data structure used in the invention has nodes with a given maximum size and implements and maintains the queue by directing additions to the first non-full node on the first edge of the data structure and deletions to a leaf node on the edge of the tree.
* Each update in the functional environment requires a time and space that are logarithmically dependent on the length of the queue.
* The node to be updated is easily accessible since the search proceeds by following the edge of the tree until a leaf node is found.
* The data structure comprises a separate header node with three elements, each of which may be empty or contain a pointer to a separate node constituting the end, the tree-shaped structure, or the beginning of the queue.
* Additions are made in such a way that the node constituting the end is always filled first, and only thereafter will an addition be made to the tree-shaped structure.
* The tree need not be updated in connection with every addition or deletion, making the updates faster and requiring less memory space.
* The queue can be inverted in constant time and space by changing the value of the identifier in the header node.
* The invention can also be implemented without a header node, in which case the bit indicating the direction of the queue can be added to the individual nodes.

</summary>

• The pixels dedicated to the first image can emit a single color, and the remaining pixels can be configured to display two colors that restore the color associated with the first pixel.

* This text describes a method and device for detecting elementary particles, such as protons, ions, electrons, neutrons, or photons, in a detector.
* A charge pulse is generated in the detector when a particle passes through it, and this pulse is converted into an electric signal and indicated or recorded.
* The method and device allow for both the detection of individual particles and the integration of signals from multiple particles, depending on the frequency or signal rate.
* The invention aims to enable the detection of small-size signals with a good signal/noise ratio, and to prevent the detection of leakage currents in high-voltage cables.
* The device includes a detector, a support capacitor, and a tapping of charge pulses or signals on the low-voltage side.
* The method and device can be used for detecting particles in particle accelerators, reactor installations, and diagnostic devices such as X-ray devices and CT scanners.
* The detector can be a diamond detector, which enables fast charge transport at room temperature and precise and reliable detection of individual particles and integration of signals.
* The invention also proposes the use of a converter material for detecting uncharged particles, and the use of fast charge transport materials for detecting particles at high count or signal rates.

• The invention describes a technique for determining the optimum value of feedback gain used in feedback control for calculating correction amount.
• Feedback control involves detecting deviation or error from a predetermined course, calculating correction amount based on the detected error, and correcting the steering angle of a vehicle according to the calculated correction amount.
• The correction amount can be calculated using P, PI, PD, or PID systems, with P, I, and D being feedback gains that greatly influence feedback control characteristics.
• A limit sensitivity process is used to find the optimum value of feedback gain, which involves obtaining the magnitude of the P gain with which the error is undergoing self-sustaining vibration and determining the optimum value of each gain based on the value of the P gain.
• The invention proposes a method of determining feedback gain that permits determining the proper value of feedback gain both easily and accurately, in a short period of time and irrespective of the kind of the subject of control.
• The method involves provisionally determining a predetermined value of feedback gain, executing feedback control using the provisionally determined feedback gain, detecting error, calculating evaluation value indicative of the character of feedback control, and calculating a feedback gain value that can provide for a suitable evaluation value.
• The invention can be applied to various fields, including moving an automatic guidance vehicle along a predetermined course, and obtaining the optimum values of feedback gains other than the P, I, and D gains.

</summary>

The document describes a mobile identification transmitter that can activate a security system of a motor vehicle and communicate with an electronic payment system. The transmitter has a housing with a receptacle for a payment element that can be brought into data communication with the payment system. The payment element can be inserted into the receptacle and removed as needed. It can have a chip with a microprocessor, circuit, or storage device to carry out payment actions with the payment system. The transmitter also includes electronics that can store identification data and communicate with the communication means on board the motor vehicle. A closure can be fastened in the receptacle to protect the components when the payment element is removed, preventing function disruptions and communication with the payment system while allowing communication with the security system. An energy storage device can be included to supply the necessary electronic components with current.

<summary>
• The text describes an imaging device, such as a xerographic machine, that becomes inactive when not in use and enters sleep mode to save energy.
• The toner used in the device has a tribo-electro-static charge that affects image quality; if the device is inactive for a long time, the tribo charge decreases, affecting image quality.
• Exemplary embodiments include methods for charging the toner to a predetermined level based on periods of inactivity, and an apparatus with an inactivity determining section and a charging section.
• The method and apparatus may be included in a xerographic machine.
• The text also describes the structure of a printing device, including a photoreceptor belt, charging station, imaging and exposure station, developer station, and transfer station.
• The developer station includes a developer housing with a developer roller, transport roller, paddle wheel conveyor, and toner concentration sensor (TC sensor) to monitor the concentration of the mixed toner and developer.
• The controller includes an inactivity determining section that determines the activity of the machine and a predicting section that predicts the next user usage.
• The inactivity determining section also includes a measuring section that measures the TC sensor, a calculating section that calculates the decay of the tribo charge of the toner, an updating section, and a storing section.
• The charging section instructs the machine to charge the toner to a predetermined level based on the decay calculated by the calculating section, and the performing section pre-runs the machine to ensure the developer is at an adequate charge level for normal printing.
</summary>

<summary>

- The present invention describes a collapsible light-shielding device for a screen, consisting of annular strips that are concentrically nested and have a tight fit. The device is designed to prevent irritating reflections on the screen and improve image clarity. It can be easily folded around the screen when not in use, taking up minimal space.
- The annular strips have hook elements or locking elements for reliable folding-in and folding-out. An adapter member is also provided for attaching the light-shielding device to various types of monitors, regardless of their front shape (flat or single/double-curved).

</summary>

<summary>

- The invention describes a two-part cover plate device for wall-mounted electrical wiring devices, such as switches and receptacles, that eliminates visible fasteners when installed. The device consists of an attachment member that is installed over a wiring device and mounted to it, and a cover plate member that latches onto the attachment member. The cover plate member has no fastener holes and is easily installed or removed using a small tool. The device can accommodate variations in wall flatness or evenness, especially when covering multiple wiring devices installed in ganged boxes.
- The device is suitable for use with a single wiring device or multiple wiring devices, with the number of pawls, racks, tabs, and slots adjusting accordingly. The document includes illustrations of the device used with one, two, three, and four wiring devices, as well as instructions for installation.

</summary>

<summary>

• The document describes a face age-estimation system and method, which can estimate the age of a person in a given image.
• The system uses a database of second image data with assigned landmark points and known ages for training.
• A contourlet appearance model (CAM) algorithm is used to extract feature vectors from face images.
• A statistical principal component analysis (PCA) model of the contourlet-level appearance is built to model the contourlet-level appearance.
• A CAM is generated by applying a further statistical PCA approach to the shape and appearance parameters.
• The system uses a feature-space-to-age-space mapping unit and a classifier to map the facial features to one of at least two differing age groups having corresponding differently calibrated mapping functions.
• The system can be implemented using a computing device with appropriate software.
• The system can be used in various applications, such as age verification in businesses, homeland security technologies, and customer relationship management.
• The system can also help identify trends in business relative to the ages of customers and prevent children from accessing unacceptable media or programming.

</summary>
